data.title: Small improvement to documentation
data.body:
I spent more than 2h to understand why get_node is not working, bug was trivial. I believe fixing documentation like that will help to avoid such problem in future for other developers.

Please merge if you find this change useful (or let me know if I pull request is all right but should be done differently).

data.title: [].sort_custom bug
Dead link in documentation
data.body:
On this page:

https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/wiki/advanced

On bottom there is a link:

https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/wiki/external_editor

But pressing it leads to:

https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/wiki

WIth error message like:

"You do not have permission to update this wiki."

I guess it's not expected behaviour.

data.title: I don't have Cast Shadows!!! Help me!
data.body: Look: I read the document Shadow Mapping and not getting these results. Is it possible my computer has no graphics support for this purpose? I am a beginner in the tool, but what I want is just a shadow projection of the objects. The video card in my computer is a Intel HD Graphics 3000.

data.title: Global Time Manipulator - SlowMotion
data.body:
This is a small request to add a global time manipulator.
This way we may create some sort of slow motion effects.

Thats it, a small reminder ;-)

data.title: Pr tween support
data.body: Add tween support for godot

data.title: Moving documentation to Readthedocs?
data.body:
Was hoping to contribute to the documentation (apply some spelling/grammar fixes like #621 if nothing else) but GitHub doesn't allow pull requests to be submitted for wiki content.

With a service like Readthedocs the documentation is created from files stored within the repository, making it easy for people to suggest changes and making less work for the moderators.

data.title: Problem with the "move_local_x" function
data.body:
Hello! 

I am creating my game on Linux. I am using the function "move_local_x" from Node2D to move my objects in the scene. Everything is normal on Linux. 

Today, I tested on Windows 8.1 and realized that the movement of objects was very fast. I believe it is a bug of the engine.

Thanks

data.title: android - remove_and_delete_node
data.body:
inside Spatial script:
get_parent().remove_and_delete_node(self) - works on windows, and crashes on Android

outside script:
node.get_parent().remove_and_delete_node(node) - works always

data.title: InputEvent.MOUSE_BUTTON on android
data.body:
GalaxyNote3 - InputEvent.SCREEN_TOUCH only (all ok)
GalaxyS3, Galaxy Wander -  InputEvent.SCREEN_TOUCH + InputEvent.MOUSE_BUTTON

generic code not works right on GalaxyS3, Galaxy Wander:
if event.type == InputEvent.SCREEN_TOUCH:
    pass
elif event.type == InputEvent.MOUSE_BUTTON:
    pass

data.title: Ambient Light on android device
data.body: The new implementation method to set ambient light in world environment seem no working in android device (godot august). But still working for previous release (June), in the light setup.

data.title: Typo in Wiki
data.body:
https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/wiki/tutorial_gui_repositioning

3rd paragraph, "let's just imagine that the screen resolution has chanced", it should be "changed" instead of "chanced"

Cheers!

data.title: Inspector side scroll bar disappears
data.body: woe, unique glitch, Inspector Scroll bar disappears when viewing an "Animation Player Node" while the window is maximized. Reappears when not maximized.

data.title: Node Tooltip does not display Node Type.
data.body: Okay this is very frustrating: When you create a node, it is named after it's node type, but it is quickly renamed or the "Replace a Node by Another Node Type" feature is used. There is no way to tell what kind of Node it is. When you move the mouse over a Node the Tooltip displays the File Location, can it be added to display the node type as well? Also hovering the mouse over the top of the Inspector where it displays the Node's Name should display the same Tooltip.

data.title: touchscreenbutton freeze engine on load in android 4
data.body:
I made 4 buttons with 2 textures each. But when do load on Android device app freeze on boot logo!
I temporarily solved it making buttons with NO texture. And define it on _ready function by programming.

data.title: automatic screen resolution
data.body:
This is currently not possible as per #6 and #140, but is sort of a must I think, as it increases immersiveness and cooperates better with some environments (such as a 16:9 Windows laptop and X11). The idea is to match the current desktop resolution (whatever it's at), and perhaps rendering as a so-called "borderless window".

Obviously, this would be best suited for fullscreen (speaking in terms of what your eyes see, not API). In windowed mode, the closest you could come would be a "maximized" window, which may or may not be supported on all desktop platforms. Of course, some users would want to set a specific resolution and have the windowed behavior unchanged but the fullscreen behavior set to scale the emulated resolution up or down as is done on mobile, either scaling the 3D or not.

[s]Also, is there a way to not show the "GODOT GAME ENGINE" logo on startup?[/s] Ehh, I found it. In the project settings, you go to startup_logo or something. Needs documentation.

Regarding the auto screen res thing, that's sort of how it usually works on Linux/X11 anyways. It's a pain the ass to change the actual desktop resolution, so a big borderless/chromeless window is what is done.

Source: http://www.tonyobryan.com/index.php?article=9

See? It shouldn't be hard for a serious programmer like you.

If a similar type of implementation could be employed on other platforms and allowing for pixel-to-pixel matching automatic resolution, that'd be awesome. The command to change the resolution programatically would make it even better because you could start with the splash window then go fullscreen at a time of your choosing. When's the next big release coming out?

data.title: tiles that are of greater size that the tile size aren't properly drawn
data.body:
Here is the thing, I'm creating tiles that represent _entire_ objects. For instance, the tiles are 32px of width and height, I'm creating a tile of a object from the texture that is 64px of width and 128px of height. The scene is exported as a tile set resource and everything is fine.

ok, the thing is when I'm using the tile set, I'm having problems when two tiles of an object are painted, the second object that should hide the first is hidden by... the first!:

![godotmap2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1055216/3789820/8b444c04-1ac6-11e4-96b2-8a5dd461f810.png)

romolux_x [gives an explanaition](http://www.godotengine.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=813&p=3769#p3768) of the issue in my forum post.

data.title: freeing WorldEnvironment issue
data.body:
There are two scenes , both have each unique WorldEnvironment. After loading the first scene using ResourceLoader.load_interactive() everything works as expected, but when switching to the next scene WorldEnv resource breaks and there is no ambient, no fxaa, nothing. Here's the output:
ERROR: VisualServerRaster:: free: Method/Function Failed. At: servers/visual/visual_server_raster.cpp:3816

data.body: Works fine for me, is it supposed to do anything else?
